018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli;
019
020import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService;
021import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture;
022import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
023import java.util.logging.Logger;
024
025import com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActorRef;
026
027/**
028 * Actor that monitors the log server and triggers auto-shutdown when idle.
029 *
030 * <p>This actor periodically checks the log server's status and decides
031 * whether to shut it down based on:</p>
032 * <ul>
033 *   <li>Number of active TCP connections</li>
034 *   <li>Time since last activity (session creation, log writes)</li>
035 * </ul>
036 *
037 * <p><strong>Shutdown Decision Logic:</strong></p>
038 * <pre>
039 * Every check interval:
040 *   1. Check for new activity (session count changes)
041 *   2. Get active connection count
042 *   3. If connections == 0 AND idle time > threshold:
043 *      â†’ Send stop message to LogServerActor
044 * </pre>
045 *
046 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
047 * @since 2.11.0
048 */
049public class ConnectionWatcherActor {
050
051    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(ConnectionWatcherActor.class.getName());
052
053    /** Default check interval: 5 minutes */
054    public static final long DEFAULT_CHECK_INTERVAL_SECONDS = 300;
055
056    /** Default idle threshold: 5 minutes with no connections */
057    public static final long DEFAULT_IDLE_THRESHOLD_SECONDS = 300;
058
059    /** Minimum uptime before auto-shutdown is allowed (to avoid immediate shutdown on startup) */
060    public static final long MINIMUM_UPTIME_SECONDS = 30;
061
062    private final ActorRef<LogServerActor> logServerActor;
063    private final long checkIntervalSeconds;
064    private final long idleThresholdSeconds;
065    private final boolean verbose;
066
067    private ScheduledFuture<?> watcherTask;
068    private volatile boolean running = false;
069
070    /**
071     * Creates a new ConnectionWatcherActor with default settings.
072     *
073     * @param logServerActor reference to the log server actor
074     */
075    public ConnectionWatcherActor(ActorRef<LogServerActor> logServerActor) {
076        this(logServerActor, DEFAULT_CHECK_INTERVAL_SECONDS, DEFAULT_IDLE_THRESHOLD_SECONDS, false);
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Creates a new ConnectionWatcherActor with custom settings.
081     *
082     * @param logServerActor reference to the log server actor
083     * @param checkIntervalSeconds interval between checks in seconds
084     * @param idleThresholdSeconds idle time threshold in seconds
085     * @param verbose enable verbose logging
086     */
087    public ConnectionWatcherActor(ActorRef<LogServerActor> logServerActor,
088                                  long checkIntervalSeconds,
089                                  long idleThresholdSeconds,
090                                  boolean verbose) {
091        this.logServerActor = logServerActor;
092        this.checkIntervalSeconds = checkIntervalSeconds;
093        this.idleThresholdSeconds = idleThresholdSeconds;
094        this.verbose = verbose;
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Starts the watcher using the provided scheduler.
099     *
100     * @param scheduler the scheduler to use for periodic checks
101     */
102    public void start(ScheduledExecutorService scheduler) {
103        if (running) {
104            return;
105        }
106
107        running = true;
108
109        // Schedule periodic checks
110        watcherTask = scheduler.scheduleAtFixedRate(
111            this::checkAndDecide,
112            checkIntervalSeconds,  // Initial delay (let server warm up)
113            checkIntervalSeconds,  // Period
114            TimeUnit.SECONDS
115        );
116
117        LOG.info("ConnectionWatcher started (check every " + checkIntervalSeconds + "s, " +
118                 "idle threshold " + idleThresholdSeconds + "s)");
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Stops the watcher.
123     */
124    public void stop() {
125        if (!running) {
126            return;
127        }
128
129        running = false;
130
131        if (watcherTask != null) {
132            watcherTask.cancel(false);
133        }
134
135        if (verbose) {
136            LOG.info("ConnectionWatcher stopped");
137        }
138    }
139
140    /**
141     * Performs a single check and decides whether to shut down the server.
142     * This method is called periodically by the scheduler.
143     */
144    public void checkAndDecide() {
145        if (!running) {
146            return;
147        }
148
149        try {
150            // Use actor's ask() to safely access the POJO
151            logServerActor.ask(server -> {
152                performCheck(server);
153                return null;
154            }).join();
155        } catch (Exception e) {
156            LOG.warning("Error during connection check: " + e.getMessage());
157        }
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Performs the actual check logic.
162     * This runs inside the actor's context.
163     */
164    private void performCheck(LogServerActor server) {
165        if (!server.isRunning()) {
166            stop();
167            return;
168        }
169
170        // Check for new activity
171        boolean hasNewActivity = server.checkForNewActivity();
172
173        // Get connection count
174        int connectionCount = server.getActiveConnectionCount();
175
176        // Get idle time (time since last activity)
177        long idleTimeMs = server.getIdleTimeMillis();
178        long idleTimeSeconds = idleTimeMs / 1000;
179
180        // Get uptime (time since server started)
181        long uptimeSeconds = java.time.Duration.between(
182            server.getStartedAt(), java.time.OffsetDateTime.now()
183        ).getSeconds();
184
185        if (verbose) {
186            LOG.info(String.format(
187                "ConnectionWatcher: connections=%d, idle=%ds, uptime=%ds, newActivity=%s",
188                connectionCount, idleTimeSeconds, uptimeSeconds, hasNewActivity
189            ));
190        }
191
192        // Decision logic:
193        // 1. Server must have been running for minimum uptime (to avoid immediate shutdown)
194        // 2. Must have no active connections
195        // 3. Must have been idle for threshold time
196        if (uptimeSeconds >= MINIMUM_UPTIME_SECONDS &&
197            connectionCount == 0 &&
198            idleTimeSeconds >= idleThresholdSeconds) {
199
200            LOG.info(String.format(
201                "Auto-shutdown: No connections for %d seconds (threshold: %ds)",
202                idleTimeSeconds, idleThresholdSeconds
203            ));
204
205            // Send stop message to the server
206            server.stop();
207            stop();
208        }
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Checks if the watcher is currently running.
213     */
214    public boolean isRunning() {
215        return running;
216    }
217}
